structure.unit: ACQUISITION AND DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC PROJECTS THROUGH REVENUE BONDS

law.catch_line: Public policy as to bond interest rates.
law.text: It is hereby determined and declared to be the public policy of the Commonwealth that interest rates payable by public bodies upon public obligations be such as to be competitive with those rates which are permitted by other states, in order that necessary public projects may be financed and may be undertaken in the interest of the public health, safety, and general welfare.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 292, effective July 13, 1990. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 2.
